newsitem.title: UK: UK's SFA orders futures broker to close down.
newsitem.headline: UK's SFA orders futures broker to close down.

text.p: British financial watchdog the Securities and Futures Authority (SFA) said on Friday it had ordered futures broker Trust Financial Group (Europe) Ltd to shut down.

The SFA said it had issued an intervention order requiring Trust to "cease forthwith from carrying on any investment business" and "arrange for the disposal or transfer of client positions and assets no later than June 13".

The watchdog said it had issued the order because Trust had "failed to monitor activity on customer accounts adequately" and it appeared "excessive or inappropriate trading may have taken place and the execution of orders may have incurred excessive charges and caused losses".
Trust had also failed to value customer option contract positions accurately and had sent customers inaccurate statements, the SFA said.
And it had failed to satisfy the SFA that it maintained adquate financial resources to meet its investment business commitments and had failed to keep financial records properly.
"It appears that Trust has been reporting incorrect balances in its financial reporting statements to SFA since June 1996," it said.
